text: The Azusa Street Revival was a revival meeting that took place on April 14, 1906. William J. Seymour had led it - he was an African-American preacher. This meeting was historic because it played an important role in the spread of Pentecostalism in the 20th century. Category:History of Los Angeles Category:Pentecostalism Category:20th century in religion
title: Azusa Street Revival
